item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I have had these, and been using them for around 6 months now, but it was in a different format for loading and saving listbox items. So I dug it up lately for my HTML Assistant program, and re-write it to work with one string, instead of many. No, I didn’t want to say, this was hard, I’m just releasing it for those who don’t know it.

All over Google, you would typically see the

richTextBox1.SaveFile(openFileDialog1.FileName)

method being used in almost every topic about it. I decided to write a different (VERY BASIC) method that will not draw errors, or have the /par at the end of each line.

First, you will need to add this to the top of the form using it, without this, you cannot access the StreamWriter and StreamReader functions.

using System.IO;

My saving method:

        private void saveFile(string path, string text)
        {
            try
            {
                StreamWriter writeFile = new StreamWriter(path);
                writeFile.WriteLine(text);
            }
            catch (Exception ex)
            {
                MessageBox.Show(Convert.ToString(ex.Message));
                return;
            }
        }

My loading method:

        private void loadFile(string path)
        {
            try
            {
                StreamReader readFile = new StreamReader(Convert.ToString(path));
                htmlTextBox1.Text = readFIle.ReadToEnd();
            }
            catch (Exception ex)
            {
                MessageBox.Show(Convert.ToString(ex.Message));
                return;
            }
        }
